result.execSummary:
The defendant Gustavo R Pineda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable as follows:  $50.00 per month starting June 15, 2015 and on the same day thereafter, until paid in full.  Failure to pay any part of the court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $100.00 on file applied to the costs.

Sentence to start on or before May 12, 2015 at  6 pm
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 14CM293.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gustavo R Pineda

records.addlTxt: from Difranco & Associates PC copies of documents

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.   Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Defendant plead guilty to count 1, as charged.  Joint recommendation for 45 days jail.  Credit for 11 days.  Victim was present and did not wish to make a statement.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights waived and the elements of the crime.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently made his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists and defendant was found guilty and plead to.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered 45 days jail, starting on or before May 12, 2015 at 6 p,.m. Concurrent with 14CM293.   Credit for 11 days.  CC payable on payment plan @ $50 per month, starting 6/15/15.    Failure to pay any part of the court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Plea/sentencing set for 5/11/15 at 10:30 am

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Must do random testing at the Lifeloc Alcohol Testing Kiosk at the Jackson County Jail once per day per direction of the jail.

Defendant appeared with counsel SPD Paul Fredrickson.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defense waives the reading of the complaint and stands mute.  Court enters not guilty pleas; sets pretrial for 4-1-15 and status conference for 4-20-15 at 3:00.  Attorney Paul Fredrickson requests an amendment to bond that defendant not have to report for testing on March 19 & 20 and he has to go out of state.  Court orders bond conditions amended that defendant does not need to test at Jackson County Jail on March 19 & 20 with other conditions remaining the same.
